verses.kjv: Then Jonah prayed unto the LORD his God out of the fishâ€™s belly,
verses.ct: From inside the fish, Jonah prayed to the LORD his God.

verses.kjv: And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the LORD, and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice.
verses.ct: He said, "In my distress I called out to the LORD, and he answered me. From the depths of the grave I cried for help, and you heard my voice.

verses.kjv: For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.
verses.ct: You hurled me into the deep, into the heart of the ocean. The currents swirled around me, and all your surging waves crashed over me.

verses.kjv: Then I said, I am cast out of thy sight; yet I will look again toward thy holy temple.
verses.ct: I thought, 'I have been driven away from your presence.' But still, I will look once more toward your holy temple.

verses.kjv: The waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.
verses.ct: The water surrounded me, threatening my very soul. The ocean depths engulfed me, and seaweed wrapped around my head.

verses.kjv: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with her bars was about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from corruption, O LORD my God.
verses.ct: I sank down to the base of the mountains. The earth locked its gates around me forever. But you, LORD my God, pulled my life up from the pit of decay.

verses.kjv: When my soul fainted within me I remembered the LORD: and my prayer came in unto thee, into thine holy temple.
verses.ct: As my soul was slipping away within me, I turned my thoughts to the LORD, and my prayer reached you in your holy temple.

verses.kjv: They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.
verses.ct: Those who cling to worthless idols abandon the mercy that could be theirs.

verses.kjv: But I will sacrifice unto thee with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that that I have vowed. Salvation is of the LORD.
verses.ct: But I will offer sacrifices to you with shouts of gratitude. What I have promised, I will fulfill. Salvation comes from the LORD."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry land.
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to the fish, and it threw Jonah up onto dry land.
